definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)

sentences.english: Keefer screamed with pain and rolled on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 吉弗疼得尖聲叫喊，在地上打滾。

sentences.english: The black horse screamed loudly, a cry of fear.
sentences.chinese: 黑駿馬大聲嘶叫起來，那是一種充滿恐懼的叫喊。

sentences.english: Some bad-tempered members shouted at the chairman during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 一些壞脾氣的會員在會議期間向主席叫喊。

sentences.english: Adam's daughter called from the wash-up.
sentences.chinese: 亞當的女兒在浴室叫喊。

sentences.english: Why do you have to go public?
sentences.chinese: 他叫喊，“爲什麼你要公開？”

sentences.english: Shoutin in the street gonna take on the world some day.
sentences.chinese: 叫喊着你將在某一天征服這世界。

sentences.english: The debate was interrupted by a clamor of opposition.
sentences.chinese: 辯論被反對方的一聲叫喊打斷。

sentences.english: "All passengers for Regoa take their places, please, " called out the guard.
sentences.chinese: “所有到雷果阿的乘客請上車，”隨車員大聲叫喊。

sentences.english: "Did you hear that?" the old dog shouted.
That lock fog valley through rhododendron bleak new sad shouting.
sentences.chinese: 那霧鎖的山谷中新透杜鵑淒涼的悲哀叫喊。

sentences.english: He was obviously doped(up),shouting and weaving down the street.
sentences.chinese: 他明顯地被麻醉了，叫喊着，搖晃着走下街道。

sentences.english: “When someone speaks in a loud tone, girls interpret it as yelling, ” Chadwell says.
sentences.chinese: 當人們高聲說話時，女孩會用叫喊打斷他。

sentences.english: Iago. What are you here that cry so grievously ?
sentences.chinese: 伊阿古你是什麼人，在這兒叫喊得這樣悽慘？

sentences.english: Or was it a cry against the hemlocks?
sentences.chinese: 或者，那是對抗鐵杉的叫喊？

sentences.english: Loud voices and a renewed uproar were raised in front of the boarding-house.
sentences.chinese: 寄宿公寓前又發出聲聲叫喊，出現了新的騷動。

sentences.english: She's yelling to beat the band.
sentences.chinese: 她大聲叫喊，壓倒了管樂隊。

definition: to cry out/to bark out a sound
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
